intro: Calycosia sessilis, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Calycosia sessilis is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
